# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple function in Julia to accomplish this:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function works by first stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces from the input string `col` using the `strip()` function, then converting it to lowercase with `lowercase()`. The `replace()` function is used to replace all spaces and hyphens in the resulting string with underscores. The regular expression `r"[\s-]+"` matches one or more whitespace characters (`\s`) or hyphens (`-`).
